window.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a space or an area of glass in the wall of a building or vehicle that lets in light
window.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Do you mind if I open the window?
She looked out of the window to see if it was raining.
The sun was shining through the windows.
We were looking at the Christmas displays in the shop windows.
window.translation[0].definitions[1].def: one of the separate areas on a computer screen where different programs are operating
window.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a short period of time that is available for a particular activity
window.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Delay might open a window of opportunity for their rivals.
window.translation[0].definitions[3].def: an area on an envelope with clear plastic in it which lets you see the address written on the letter inside the envelope
window.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: I opened the window and breathed in the fresh air.
Lucy rolled the window down and waved to him.
Mom stared out of the window at the road.
A breeze from the open window lifted her hair.
I don't want people looking in my front window.
The burglar had got in through one of the back windows.
The car's rear window had been bashed in.
From his bedroom window he could see two men having an argument.
She had left the kitchen window open.
The church has fine medieval stained glass windows.
window.translation[1].definitions[0].def: one of the separate areas on a computer screen where different processes or programs are operating
window.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: You can make a window larger or smaller by dragging its corner with the mouse.
window.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a short period of time that is available for a particular activity
window.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: There is a 12- to 24-month buying window in the domestic real estate markets before prices start going up again.
window.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if a product is in the window, it is on display at the front of a shop to encourage customers to come in
window.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: A customer may ask to buy some goods displayed in the window.
